item.title: About me
item.description: #my-photo { width: 16rem; margin:0; padding: 0rem; margin: 1rem 1rem 0.5rem 0rem; border-radius: 50%; clear: both; } @media screen and (min-width: 400px) { #my-photo { float: left; } } Hello! I'm Arthur Zucker - I recently graduated from Sorbonne University's Applied Mathematics and computer science engineering school (Polyetch Sorbonne University), and I am currently enrolled at the ENS Paris-Saclay, at the MVA (Mathematics, Vision et Apprentissage) master's degree.

item.title: [MVA] RL : Reinforcement Learning, how to model an RL problem: Markov Decision Processes
item.description: r { color: Red } o { color: Orange } g { color: Green } b { color: Blue } The course is provided by Matteo Pirotta a Facebook AI Researcher, and is based on one of the previous MVA RL classes by Alessandro Lazaric (FAIR). @TODO add links to their linkdin or websites Introduction What is RL? When to use it? Why RL? RL, a short for Reinforcement Learning, is a subclass of machine learning, which focuses on building a model able to learn from his action in an environnement.

item.title: Automatic Table Structure Recogniton
item.description: During my 3rd yearh internship at Chainos Solution, my collegue Younes Belkda and I developped an automatic Table structure recogniton based on Artificial intelligence. We called it CLUSTI! Problem statement Some organizations still use huge amounts of scanned tables / invoices. Rather than manually typing the contents of the tables into an excel file, one can think of using Deep Learning to tackle this problem. Once you identify the distinguishable cells on the tables, we can pass an OCR (Optical Character Recognition) to each cell to read its contents and convert it to an excel file for example.
